titleStmt.title: A Iewes prophesy, with newes from Rome of two mightie armies, aswell footemen as horsmen, the first of the great Sophy, the other of an Hebrew people, till this time not discouered, comming from the mountaines of Caspij, who pretend their warre is to recouer the land of promise, & expell the Turks out of Christendome / translated out of Italian into English by W.W. 1607.
titleStmt.author: Buonaccorsi, Andrea.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W.I. for Henry Gosson, and are to be sold in Pater noster rowe at the signe of the Sunne,

notesStmt.note: Also published under title: Newes from Rome.
"A modernized version of Ǹewes come latle fro[m] Pera, of two most mighty armies, ́which is signed on A6v: Andrew Ben accorto"--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Attributed to Andrea Buonaccorsi by STC (2nd ed.).
Place and date of publication suggested by NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University. Library.

place.placeName: Pater noster rowe at the signe of the Sunne
